meanings.sent1: The king decided to depose the corrupt official from his position.
meanings.sent2: The board voted to depose the CEO due to financial misconduct.
meanings.sent3: It was time to depose the old, dusty furniture and bring in some new pieces.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to depose the leaves from the trees in a swift motion.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's red pen was ready to depose any incorrect answers on the test.

meanings.sent1: The witness was asked to depose about what he saw at the scene.
meanings.sent2: In court, the defendant will depose to tell the truth about the incident.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was trained to depose about the daily activities in the house.
meanings.sent4: The old diary seemed to depose secrets of the past with each page turned.
meanings.sent5: The detective hoped the suspect would depose and reveal the truth about the crime.

meanings.definition: To take a statement from someone.
meanings.sent1: The investigator needed to depose the witness to gather more information.
meanings.sent2: The journalist will depose the celebrity for an exclusive interview.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat seemed to depose the mouse about its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The reporter was eager to depose the politician for a breaking news story.
meanings.sent5: The detective planned to depose the suspect to uncover the mystery behind the crime.
